result.execSummary:
The defendant Thomas D. Gilson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
If Probation or Extended Supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. 
3 days of jail credit if revoked from Probation

miscConds.notes: PAYABLE DIRECTLY TO AND COLLECTED BY EAU CLAIRE COUNTY CLERK OF COURT.  NOT A CONDITION OF PROBATION.

records.addlTxt:
Order Denying Defendant's Requests for Release Modification or Change in Sentence
As to all requests -- 09/22, 09/29, 10/06, 10/13/2022: It is ordered that the above request is denied. 
Per the Court: 1. This is not the proper forum to request a sentence modification. 2. None of the reasons mentioned meet the criteria for a sentence modification.

Order Denying Defendant's Request for Release Modification or Change in Sentence
It is ordered that the above request is denied. Per the Court: This does not rise to the level of a sentence modification.

Order and Amendment to Judgment of Conviction in Probation Cases
The Court Orders: It is hereby ordered and adjudged that as to count 1 the Defendant is ordered to serve 6 months 0 days of jail time as a condition of probation.
Proposed Order and Amendment to Judgment of Conviction in Probation Cases
Dated 09/01/2022, Letter from Probation and Parole Agent Victoria Larson to Court requesting conditional jail time be imposed.
Petition and Stipulation to Amend Judgment of Conviction in Probation Cases
Reminder Notice regarding financial obligations (Unable to forward per USPS)
Reminder Notice indicating amount due mailed to defendant.

9:05 AM Cases called:21CM471 & 22CF2 Defendant Thomas D. Gilson appeared by phone, Attorney Katherine Cook appeared by video for Thomas D. Gilson, Attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. There is an agreement. Victim/Witness statute complied with. Defendant waives right to appear in person. Defendant will enter a no contest plea to 21CM471 Count 1: Disorderly Conduct  as a Domestic and as a Repeater and Count 1 in 22CF2: Possession of Methamphetamine as a Repeater. Priors as related to these counts are acknowledged. Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights. Court accepts plea and finds the defendant guilty. 
Court orders:
18 months Probation sentence withheld with conditions on each count concurrent.
Conditions of Probation:
60 days jail with Huber - 5 days can be served with 40 hours of community service - 55 days stayed pending further order of the court - on Count 1 in 22CF2 only.
No contact with any known drug dealers/users except in a therapeutic setting. 
No contact with J.S. without her and agent's approval.
Maintain absolute sobriety. 
AODA and follow through with recommendations. 
Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge. 
Any conditions, programming or treatment per the agent and follow through with recommendations. 

Anything else is ordered dismissed and read in. 
Jail credit:4 days in 21CM471 and 3 days in 22CF2
Defendant's Waiver of Personal Appearance
Same as Complaint.
Arraignment on March 1, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Arraignment on March 1, 2022 at 09:00 am.

9:31 AM Cases called: 21CM471 & 22CF2. Prosecuting attorney Kelly Ronquist appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Thomas D. Gilson appeared by video, in custody from the Chippewa County Jail.  Attorney Katherine Cook appeared in court for Thomas D. Gilson. Defendant waives right to appear in person. Defendant waives right to a preliminary hearing in 22CF2 and Court accepts waiver. Referred to Br. 3 for scheduling. 21CM471 to ride along.
